abstract: iran is rocked by anti-government protests which have left ` at least 12 dead '
article: at least two of those killed were shot dead in the most serious unrest iran has seen since 2009 , with calls for more protests to take place todayat least 12 people have reportedly been killed during anti-government protests in iran , as demonstrations spread across the country . state tv announced the latest death toll as the most serious unrest iran has seen since 2009 continues , with calls for more action to take place today . tens of thousands of people have demonstrating across the country against the islamic republic 's government and economic woes , prompting authorities to warn of a tough crackdown .

there has been anger towards iran 's clerical establishment , which has been in power since the 1979 revolution . reutersafpafpwoman branded `` a hero '' for removing hijab during anti-government protests in iranthere have also been calls for supreme leader ayatollah ali khamenei to step down as crowds chant against a government they described as ` thieves ' . two of the dead were shot and killed on sunday in the southwestern town of izeh and several others were injured , ilna news agency quoted local member of parliament hedayatollah khademi as saying . reutersafp `` i do not know whether yesterday 's shooting was done by rally participants or the police and this issue is being investigated , '' khademi said .

messages on social media urged iranians to hold rallies in the capital tehran and 50 other urban centres . many cities have already seen four days of unrest since cost of living protests in the second largest city mashhad on thursday turned political . protests continued overnight even though president hassan rouhani appealed for calm . afpreutersnazanin zaghari ratcliffe 's husband is hopeful for a boxing day birthday releasehe said iranians had the right to criticise authorities but warned of a crackdown against unrest . `` the government will show no tolerance for those who damage public properties , violate public order and create unrest in the society , '' rouhani said in remarks carried by state tv .
